intro: Cynoglossum macrolimbe, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or borders. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
